article_title: CANDYLAND: DOC hosts annual Trunk-or-Treat event Saturday
article_text:
Print Email Font Resize Font Resize Canon City Breaking News, Sports, Weather, Traffic CANDYLAND: DOC hosts annual Trunk-or-Treat event Saturday

Fran Flubacker and the Trujillo clan: Marie, Andy, Mike and Debbie, dress as 'The Beverly Hillbillies' during the annual Trunk-or-Treat event Saturday at Macon Plaza. (Carie Canterbury / Daily Record) Department of Corrections employee John Gonzales, dressed as Shrek, hands out candy Saturday during the annual Trunk-or-Treat event at Macon Plaza. (Carie Canterbury / Daily Record) Hundreds of children of all ages lined up Saturday to take part in the annual Trunk-or-Treat event hosted by the Colorado Department of Corrections employees at Macon Plaza. Trunk-or-Treat organizers Jim Moore and Sarah Cordova said about 1,200 pounds of candy was collected by the Colorado State Penitentiary and Centennial Correctional Facility, and Canteen Services also donated a 4' X 4' X 4' pallet of treats. Many DOC facilities participated in the event, as well as the Fremont County Sheriff's Office, Colorado State Patrol and Cañon City Area Fire Protection District. To view more photos, visit facebook.com/CanonCityDailyRecord. Philip Smith, 2, is dressed as a kissing booth Saturday during the annual Trunk-or-Treat event at Macon Plaza (Carie Canterbury / Daily Record) Carie Canterbury: 719-276-7643, canterburyc@canoncitydailyrecord.com or twitter.com/cariecanterbury



Brooke Watley, 10, dresses as a snack machine during the annual Trunk-or-Treat event Saturday at Macon Plaza. (Carie Canterbury / Daily Record)

Trooper Dan Brusuelas of the Colorado State Patrol hands out candy Saturday during the annual Trunk-or-Treat event at Macon Plaza. (Carie Canterbury / Daily Record)

Fran Flubacker and the Trujillo clan: Marie, Andy, Mike and Debbie, dress as 'The Beverly Hillbillies' during the annual Trunk-or-Treat event Saturday at Macon Plaza. (Carie Canterbury / Daily Record)
